verses.kjv: I will extol thee, O LORD; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
verses.ct: I will praise you, LORD, because you pulled me up and didn't let my enemies celebrate my downfall.

verses.kjv: O LORD my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
verses.ct: LORD my God, I called out to you, and you healed me.

verses.kjv: O LORD, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
verses.ct: LORD, you brought my soul up from the grave; you kept me alive so I wouldn't descend into the pit.

verses.kjv: Sing unto the LORD, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
verses.ct: Sing to the LORD, all you who are devoted to him, and give thanks as you remember his holiness.

verses.kjv: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.
verses.ct: His anger lasts only a moment, but his favor lasts a lifetime. Crying may last through the night, but joy arrives in the morning.

verses.kjv: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.
verses.ct: When everything was going well, I told myself, 'Nothing will ever shake me.'

verses.kjv: LORD, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.
verses.ct: LORD, through your favor you made me as secure as a mountain. But when you withdrew your favor, I was filled with distress.

verses.kjv: I cried to thee, O LORD; and unto the LORD I made supplication.
verses.ct: I called out to you, LORD; I pleaded with you for mercy.

verses.kjv: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?
verses.ct: What do you gain from my death, from my going down into the pit? Can dust praise you? Can it proclaim your faithfulness?

verses.kjv: Hear, O LORD, and have mercy upon me: LORD, be thou my helper.
verses.ct: Listen, LORD, and show me mercy! LORD, be my helper.

verses.kjv: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;
verses.ct: You transformed my grief into dancing; you stripped away my mourning clothes and dressed me in joy,

verses.kjv: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
verses.ct: so that my whole being would sing praise to you and never stop. LORD my God, I will thank you forever.
